page.title: 03THE CASTLES
page.content:
There are two castles in the block. {OLD KEISS CASTLE}was built by the Sinclair family in the late 16th.C, on top of cliffs which jut out into the sea. The defence of the castle was also helped by the design. Extra turrets were built at two corners so that marksmen could shoot across the front of the walls, not just outwards. Only the outer walls remain. It is a favourite walk for some, along the shore and up to the castle.
{NEW KEISS CASTLE}is much younger, building commencing in 1763. It is now owned by a family which comes for holidays during the summer time. Visitors - often Americans - go there for holidays. A family lives there all the time looking after the castle.
